author: Matt Wallace
text: 'Food and service was great.  We got the Eggplant Caserole
column5: Chicken and Shrimp Scampi
column6: and the Chicken Cutlets.  All were amazing.  100% best Italian food in Hoboken!'

author: John Pope
text: 'Try the short rib ragu!'

author: Anna Boot
text: "I had the Italian Chicken & Sausage Gravy at brunch last weekend.  It was the best thing I've eaten in a long time.  I can't wait to eat there again."

author: Renee Giusti
text: 'Ssooo great to see you Frankie...Restaurant is awesome.. Really nice to see your Brother Peter..You are both family.. .Coming to Hoboken is coming home. Thankyou for the fun memories..‚ù§üç∑'

author: Andrew Kowalsky
text: 'Great food and service.'

author: Anthony Spirito
text: "All of their dishes are pretty good at the bare minimum
column5: but some of them have been the best meals I've eaten outside of my home. I think La Nonna has more street cred
column6: but I think the Short Rib Rag√π is easily the best thing I've ordered so far."

author: marlene feliz
text: 'My absolute favorite dish is the Shrimp Tavolo! So delicious and flavorful with the risotto always perfectly cooked! The service is friendly
column5: attentive and prompt
column6: the owner Frank is very gracious and their host John is outstanding!  Everyone works together! My experience here has been nothing short of amazing at every visit! This is definitely my Go-To place for lunch or dinner with family or friends.  Perfect place for a cocktail with friends.'

author: Alex Loginov
text: 'The chicken parmesan was so good! üòãüëç'

author: Bill Schramm
text: 'Just went there for after dinner drinks
column5: but really liked the atmosphere. Looking forward to having dinner there soon'

author: Teri Ferraro
text: 'Delicious octopus
column5: spicy stuffed pepper and scrumptious pasta dishes.'

author: Ryan Black
text: 'Extremely good. Very very good.'

author: Ed Bocchino
text: "Mediocre
column5: unauthentic theme park food. Red sauce and pasta tasted like Prego and Butoni from the supermarket. Spaghetti was undercooked and inedible. Unsanitary outdoor area with trash bins adjacent to tables drawing rodents in clear view of diners
column6: broken toilet in men's room
column7: lipstick on wine glass. Friendly staff and fast service keep it from one star. Hate to leave a review like this especially when so many hospitality businesses are hurting but please clean up."

author: Jessica P
text: 'Food was ok
column5: service was extremely slow. Everyone was very nice and the owner checked on us a few times. Would recommend the mussels and bruschetta'

author: Russell Furino
text: 'Best Italian food in Hoboken.  We visit several times a month.  Brunch is a ten as is the dinner'

author: Nicole Jala
text: 'Plenty of delicious menu options to choose from
column5: with friendly service and great outdoor seating!'

author: Sara Krastins
text: 'Went for brunch and had a great experience. The staff was super friendly and attentive and the food was great. They also have some great pitcher deals on Saturdays and Sundays for brunch. Will definitely be back!'

author: Carla Guastella
text: 'Never disappoints! If you have not dined at Il Tavolo Di Palmisano you must get there ASAP! The food is fabulous
column5: staff is very friendly and owner Frank is always so personable and kind. This restaurant delivers consistency and that is why it keeps everyone coming back! We just love it...They off outdoor seating
column6: and the ambiance set inside is trendy but homey... All around 5 stars!'

author: jon M
text: 'A Hoboken hidden Gem for sure! We went for dinner last night - food was incredible. Had the stuffed rigatoni. Really amazing- the staff was extremely nice. Shout out to Dante who really had an amazing personality and made us laugh. The owner Frank came over to ask how everything was and if they can improve anything which we really enjoyed. He is doing a great job and we are so happy this place is right around the block from our house. Stop thinking about it just go!!! We will definitely be back soon. Bravo üëè great local place!'

author: Christopher DeCosimo
text: 'Their short rib ragu is delicious! Excellent service and great atmosphere. Highly recommend! Will definitely be back to try their carbonara'

author: Marcia Barnes
text: 'Has on site parking and also is clean and satisfying. The staff was quick and responsive making the out easy and enjoyable.'

author: Angie Gutermuth
text: 'Honestly the worst food and bar experience I‚Äôve ever had. We ordered the mussels which came out dry
column5: rubbery
column6: and smelled like they were bad. We sent them back and then attempted to order the fried burrata. It came out and was cold in the center. We sent that back as well. In my entire adult life I‚Äôve never ever sent food back. Service was also terrible. When our mussels came out
column7: we asked for utensils and plates. None ever came. We went to hostess and she pointed at the bin of utensils. We were sitting at the bar for almost 2 hours & after ordering our drink at very beginning
column8: never had anyone come back to us. This was a Monday night between 4:30-6:30. We were literally 2 of 4 people sitting at the bar.'

author: Agnes Damato (Wallace)
text: "The service was fabulous! The food is beyond delicious. Just like my very Italian Nonna use to make
column5: and even more delicious
column6: dishes Nonna never made. Frank Palmisano and his staff are extremely accommodating. The portions are very big
column7: and well priced. You won't be sorry."

author: Kesavanand M
text: 'Close to home. So my goto restaurant when there are guests. Their seating outside is perfect.'

author: Melody Ann Carey
text: 'My favorite restaurant in Hoboken!'

author: Joe Minuti
text: 'Delicious Italian cuisine. Pasta is delicious. Risotto is cooked al dente.'

author: Tom DeBerardine
text: "We stopped in for dinner. The food was good
column5: but my friend and I seemed like an afterthought. We didn't exactly feel clean by the end of the meal after you left a dirty rag on our table with the check. I'm not sure what we did to earn such disrespect."

author: Jacob M
text: 'Really great food and service. The shrimp appetizer was delicious
column5: as was the chicken cutlet!'

author: Matthew
text: 'Grilled octopus and mussels in red sauce were excellent. Entrees good overall
column5: but the red sauce in the linguini and clams was like tomato soup. Service was a bit lacking and the bread was soggy.'

author: priscilla bass
text: "I love Italian cuisine and came here because of all the great reviews. Honestly
column5: I think I had high expectations considering the reviews posted and pricing for their menu.  I believe it to be average! I diffidently had better food else and don't think I'll be coming back."

author: Dennis Mino
text: 'Good food and great service'

author: Mario Tridente
text: 'Food was stellar. Real authentic Italian food. Family owned business. Drinks are so good too. The leechee martini üç∏ all day. The specials are always different when I go. Love this place. Fried burrata was out of this world.'

author: David Vaknin
text: 'The food was out of this world and everyone in the place is so nice and welcoming!!'

author: Lawrence Bobrow
text: 'Great food
column5: great drinks
column6: nice atmosphere

author: James Muraca
text: 'Top notch service
column5: food booze and atmosphere!'

author: adam decicco
text: 'Everything was fabulous. Portions are more than adequate. Nothing over seasoned. Courteous and attentive staff. Very reasonable prices. Beautiful newly constructed outdoor space.'

author: Michelle T
text: "Really good food
column5: excellent service! Our server Conrad and the manager (Robert) were both super friendly and very helpful! This is our second visit
column6: and we'll certainly come here again!"

author: Preet Gandhi
text: 'Amazing food
column5: quaint place
column6: and a very friendly owner who cares for the customer experience . We ordered the bruschetta
column7: stuffed rigatoni With buratta . Very tasty ! One of the freshest and best buratta I‚Äôve ever had .'

author: Carlito Cabelin
text: 'My first visit- linguini and clams\nSecond- Short ribs ragu\nBoth visits- almond cake!!!'

author: Ru-Ern Chee
text: 'Honestly a bit overhyped I feel. Really loud indoors (both pumping music and two very loud tables near us) so if you‚Äôre not inclined to shout to be heard by your brunch partner sit outside. Food was pretty decent but nothing to justify the sheer number of times it gets recommended on the Hoboken fb page I felt. Service good
column5: prices standard.'

author: Paulina Pazmino
text: 'Great food great place to spend with family'

author: Mohamed Elbarkatawy
text: 'Small portions and the food had no flavor. Staff is great though.'

author: Joe Pellegrini
text: 'Food
column5: Atmosphere
column6: service and staff was excellent.'

author: Robb Gill
text: 'Wow! Delicious family Italian menu based masterpiece. Great classic Chicken Parm
column5: also Great Grilled  Salmon w Spinach and Risotto!\nFabulous Pasta dishes\nand and and Fun Friendly Service !'

author: Erica S
text: 'Had a great group dinner here for my friend‚Äôs birthday! We enjoyed the garlic shrimp
column5: arugula salad
column6: and bruschetta appetizers. Some entrees we ordered: eggplant
column8: carbonara - all excellent! The staff were so kind
column10: and helpful. Can‚Äôt wait to go back!'

author: Pete
text: 'Food was good
column5: try the stuffed peppers. Service was good too üëç'

author: cristina marin
text: 'Highly recommended!! Their bruschettas were amazing!'

author: Richard Kaplan
text: "This was the second time we were here with my daughter and her family. Because of covid
column5: the restaurant set up large plastic igloos outside so diners have their group's own private space. The food is excellent.Last week I had the chicken cutlet parmesian sandwhich for $12. It was huge and I took half of it back. Today we had a delightful brunch. I had the short rib grilled cheese sandwhich
column6: also $12 which was fantastic! We will be back!"

author: Kim MacDonald
text: 'Food was delicious! Atmosphere was wonderful! Service was outstanding!'

author: Luminita F
text: 'The food here is amazing. Had the best salmon piccata. Shrimp al tavolo and short ribs were also exceptional.'

author: Michael Borelli
text: 'The service was courteous
column5: professional
column6: and welcoming. The food was almost indescribably delicious.'

author: Nat D1523
text: 'Best Italian food around! Highly recommend the braised short ribs with polenta and the eggplant casserole. WOW!'

author: Daniel Dunn
text: 'Great Chef Great Food!\nDon‚Äôt miss this one!'

author: Licia McClary
text: "Before writing this I wasn't sure if I would give 5 stars because our immediate impression from the hostess wasn't the best.  We had reserved an outside igloo
column5: we arrived on time and she said we would have to wait as the table was not free yet.  I pointed out that there were three open tables outside. all the same size and she still said we'll they are reserved so you will have to wait 10 to 15 minutes? Huh? I went outside to wait...She came out and said I can seat you at one of the open tables...well ok we got to sit
column6: I assume the manager inside who heard me questioning her told her to seat us as no one else was waiting.  Now the reason I did give 5 stars is #1 the servers are terrific.  Dominique was our main person but each and every person on the wait staff looks out for you.  They were all attentive
column7: pleasant and gave great recommendations from the menu.  We chose everything by their say so.  #2 food was absolutely delicious. Cooked perfectly
column8: and a nice portion.  We also had the pork chop but I unfortunately took a bad pic of that.  We have not eaten out in months as we do not do the indoor dining thing right now.  We figure we have been so conservative for a year
column9: why change that now.  We will wait until summer when the whole shot thing is under control.  However
column11: the igloo's are a fabulous idea for us conservative couples. It was a glorious sunny Sunday afternoon but they also have heaters in them so I am sure they are comfortable then too. My hunny cannot be around anyone right now he must be ultra conservative but we were really dying to get out just this one time since winter set in! Love the place overall
column12: will go back again. Look forward to another meal here."

author: Catherine Anlas
text: 'Excellent dinner with friends! Love the ambience in the back room. Our waiter
column5: Jared
column6: was absolutely fantastic. Wish he could be our waiter everywhere! Highly recommend for date night/out with friends
column7: the stuffed rigatoni (add salmon!) and the almond cake is to DIE for.'

author: Benny Liang
text: 'Good'

author: Alexandra Raspanti
text: 'Food
column5: cocktails and service were amazing!! Can‚Äôt believe I have lived around the corner for almost a year and Friday night was my first time here. I had an Aperol Spritz and short rib ravioli and it was incredible. Not to mention cannolis and ice box cake for dessert! Server was very pleasant and the owner even came and checked on us a few times. He was great to chat with and so sweet. Will definitely be back here real soon!!'

author: Eric Hammer
text: 'First of all
column5: credit to Il Tavolo for opening their doors in tandem with the world shutting down
column6: and still standing tall today. That timing would be a death sentence for many lesser businesses
column7: so congratulations on your early success!\n\nI finally got here a few weeks ago
column9: and had a great experience. The fried calamari was good not great
column10: we loved the stuffed long hots
column11: but the chicken cutlet w burrata (I forget the actual name) was the highlight of the night. I wish it had more balsamic and more roasted red peppers
column12:
but this is a ‚Äúmust try‚Äù as far as I‚Äôm concerned.

I also spoke w the business via IG and they were grateful for me coming in. It‚Äôs nice when a business lets you know those types of things. Can‚Äôt wait to get back here again soon.

2/1 UPDATE:
Stopped in again with friends recently and had another great dinner. The grilled octopus starter was fantastic
column13: as were the stuffed peppers. For mains
column14: we split the short rib (best dish of the night)
column16: and pork chop and peppers.\n\nAnother great meal. I hope Il Tavolo sticks around for a while. They can hang with any italian restaurant in Hoboken'

author: Victoria
text: 'My roommate and I tried this restaurant for the first time tonight and it was amazing! We sat outside in one of the bubbles and it was so cute. We got a bottle of Chianti
column5: 2 of the bruschetta plates (artichoke heart and roasted pepper)
column6: the stuffed rigatoni and the short rib raviolis. Everything was delicious! The service was great and the owner even checked on us himself a few times. Definitely 10/10 recommend! We‚Äôll be back for sure!!'

author: Melissa L
text: 'I am 9 months pregnant and have rarely gone out since the pandemic. After deciding to go here for a date night
column5: this preggo is very happy. We had the bruschetta board for a sampler. I‚Äôve never had bruschetta like this. All were VERY good (broccoli rabe
column6: tomato
column7: prosciutto) but my absolute favorite was the roasted tomato with hot honey. I can‚Äôt wait to go back for it. We also shared the Pete‚Äôs shrimp which had a good spicy kick. I can‚Äôt wait to back after baby and this time to have a cocktail with my appetizer. Husband loved the Mediterranean mule.'

author: Howard Reisen
text: 'Food was fantastic
column5: and delicious Staff was very helpful and professional highly recommend this place for a great time out.'

author: jennifer donahue
text: 'Delicious! Thanks for hosting us for my Birthday! ‚ù§'

author: Melanie Kaye
text: 'We ate this past weekend in their private "igloo\'s".  It was about 30 degree\'s out but the igloo was warm enough to take off coats and relax.  The food was SO good: had tortellini special
column5: Chicken cutlet entree and some kids dishes.  Highly highly recommend.'

author: Nubia Cruz
text: 'Amazing food and great service!'

author: Neil Amaral
text: "Second time at Il Tavolo and the food was great again. My first visit
column5: I had Chicken Parmigiano with Linguine. It was fantastic and I evn had some left overs. This time I copied my wife's first order of Shrimp Pete's over Linguine and it was amazing. The service wasn't too attentive the second visit
column6: but they were busy and understaffed. Chalk it up to growing pains. Will definitely be back for more."

author: Daniel Scheetz
text: 'Wow!  Excellent meals!  We had multiple bruschetta boards
column5: Burrata as appetizers.  Chicken Parm was best ever had.  The sauce was not acidic
column6: chicken was tender
column7: crust was not over cooked.  The La Noona
column9: pork and meatballs with pasta was outstanding.  The short ribs ragu special was delicious and portions are plentiful.  Nice atmosphere

author: Ryan Miller
text: 'Amazing went whe under covid rules last night with my sister. Outdoor seating was in a plastic bubble so we were safely distanced from all other customers. Although it was chilly outside we were warm in our bubbleWe had the excellent fried calamari as an appetizer. I had the carbaonara and my sister had stuffed rigatoni with vodka sauce and burrata.'

author: Rich S.
text: "This has been a place I have wanted to try for a long time but haven't had the chance to get to Hoboken.  We sat in an igloo outside which was clean and heated.  We had apps
column5: dinner and dessert. All of our food was absolutely amazing!!  I would definitely recommend the pork chop!"

author: S. Everdien
text: 'Drove 3 hrs one way to try this beautiful restaurant last night
column5: a very worthwhile trip!  Stars of the evening were flavorful octopus
column6: crispy delicately breaded calamari
column7: THE tenderest short ribs in pristine gravy
column8: FRESH pasta with dreamy creamy carbonara
column10: take the cannoli."  Top quality wine & liquor to rival 5 star hotels.  Our server Edward struck the perfect balance of highly attentive yet low-key.  Hit this gem now before word gets out and the wait becomes weeks.'

author: Darek Michael
text: 'Hands down best Chicken Piccata I‚Äôve ever had! üòç Great atmosphere
column5: even better food and good service. Came on a Monday night and got the octopus and meatballs for appetizers (10/10) and the short ribs / chicken piccata for entrees. Both fantastic. Would recommend to anyone and will be coming back myself!'

author: Anthony Spano
text: "Disappointed actually. The mussels red sauce was canned. The cutlet with burrata was OK. The chef has a problem with seasoning food. Very bland the wine was good and the place is very pretty. I'm going to give it another shot. However I will not order anything with red  sauce"

author: Kashmira Mehta
text: "Service was excellent
column5: but the potato hash was nothing more than a medley of potato chips with an egg on top
column6: not quite sure how this constituted a brunch main meal. They comp'ed me for the meal but it was slightly underwhelming especially compared to everyone else's dish!"

author: Joe Tierney
text: 'Prices not worth it.'

author: James Musto
text: "Been here several times and I am never disappointed it's always fantastic\nIf you enjoy Italian food this is the place for you"

author: Faye Layman
text: 'My friend and I went here for dinner. I saw their individual bubbles to keep outdoor diners warm and had to try it. We had a great experience and ended up hanging out for 2 hours. The bubble had a personal heater which was a huge plus. We had a couple of the bruschetta and ordered La Nonna and the Pork Osso Bucco for our entrees. The food was excellent and the service was great. Highly recommend them.'

author: Milton Vargas
text: "Probably one of my favorite places in Hoboken. The food never disappoints
column5: the bar selection is great
column6: we alway have a friendly staff member. I've recommended this place to a couple of people and they always enjoy it as well."

author: Samuel Wilson
text: 'Look at the surface and it looks like a fantastic restaurant to dine in/at. Good refurbishment
column5: nice crockery and glasses
column6: well presented food. Scratch below the surface and you‚Äôll actually find a sub par experience.\n\nWe called to be added to the waitlist. At the maximum time given
column7: we called back to enquire about the status of our wait
column8: only be told we were called and we missed our turn. I asked the hostess to check the call list and call me back. Two minutes later she calls back and let‚Äôs me know that she called the wrong number.\n\nWhen we arrive at the restaurant
column9: there‚Äôs an apology. Greatly appreciated. Sat at a very pleasant table outdoors with a personal heater. Nice atmosphere. Menu via QR reader as most places are nowadays. 15 mins later ask the hostess to ask the waiter to come to our table. At this point
column12: nothing.\n\nTakes order and quick service from there. Food is good. Not great
column14: so-so octopus and nice burrata. Entrees arrived quickly after.\n\nOur cutlery arrived five minutes later. In the interim I asked for black pepper for my carbonara. A mixed chili shaker like you would find in a Pizza Hut 10 years ago arrived. I asked for black pepper again
column15: old school salt and pepper shaker arrived. Join the 20th century and order grinders (I know it‚Äôs the 21st
column16: but I‚Äôd be happy if they joined the 20th).\n\nCarbonara was thicc. Tasty
column17: but not traditional. Heavy cream used in sauce
column18: served with a burnt fried egg. My colleague had salmon which she enjoyed.\n\nPrice was reasonable. Since I moved from the U.K.
column20: but I felt compelled to only tip 15% today. I had high hopes when I planned my attendance
column21: but walked away with an unusual taste in my mouth. Could be the cream from the carbonara
column22: could be the glitter they used to cover mediocrity.'

author: William L
text: "Stopped by for a snack and drinks. We didn't realize it was a half hour before opening but they sat us anyway. Great food and staff."

author: Adriana Puga
text: 'I got the Eggs in Purgatory
column5: the sauce was just perfect'

author: marco daniele
text: 'The food is fantastic!! Great atmosphere too!!'

author: James Provence
text: 'awesome food. remodel is nice'

author: Charles Defiglio
text: 'Outstanding food!'

author: Ayesha Tariq Khan
text: 'Went there pretty last min on a Saturday night. They accommodated us instantly and gave us a great table outside. The service was impeccable
column5: quick and gracious. Apps were delicious - we tried the watermelon salad
column6: the calamari  and the artichoke cakes. The entrees we shared family style and ordered a few. The shrimp risotto stood out. Overall 10/10 experience. Service is welcoming
column7: the staff is super attentive and kind and the food is delicious!'

author: Thomas Kennedy jr
text: 'Amazing service\nAmazing meal'

author: Madelyn La Vardera
text: 'best cacio e pepe around....and most delicious Negronis!!!! beautiful
column5: warm atmosphere and very professional
column6: informed staff. (thanks Jay!) so glad Tavolo was able to stay open through covid
column7: looking forward to being able to come sit down again soon!!'

author: G Morales
text: 'Always a pleasure...great staff n the owner treat u like a family member regardless who it is...food is awsome...definitely recommended to everyone for any occasions...my favorite place to be at‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§‚ù§Frankieboy#1'

author: Rossy Guzman Salzer
text: 'The food was delicious and the outdoor set up is really nice!  The artichoke bruschetta was nice
column5: but the the portobello mushroom appetizer was off the hook and the eggplant casserole which was the hit of the night.'

author: Merlo Music
text: 'Shrimp risotto is üëåüòç'

author: Kamran
text: 'Delicious authentic Italian food prepared in a no-fuss traditional way. Great wine options by the glass. Our waiter Konrad accomodated us with fantastic attentive service
column5: which was greatly appreciated. We had a chance to chat with Frank
column6: the owner
column7: who came around to check on guests as well. Will certainly return and bring friends!'

author: The Keiretsu Foundation Ltd.
text: 'Great Local Addition to our neighborhood!'

author: Lou Luglio
text: 'Excellent food and drinks!   The service was also outstanding.  Watermelon martini
column5: fried calamari
column6: seafood salad

author: David D√≠az
text: 'We dined outside. They managed to place all the tables in the sidewalk and it works perfectly. The food is amazing and fast... Go and check it out'

author: Lauren Fitzpatrick
text: 'The service was excellent and the food exceptional! We had the hardest time figuring out what to order because the menu was that good! Highly recommend.'

author: Genevieve
text: 'Great service and nice ambiance.'

author: Ken Adams
text: 'Love this place. The food was delicious the the service great. Zero complaints! We sat outside due to covid so seating was limited but it was still a great atmosphere. Would definitely recommend'

author: Erin Hille
text: 'Best service
column5: bar tenders
column6: drinks

author: Marcella Georgetta
text: 'Delicious Italian cuisines and fast delivery service! Great job guys!'

author: Marco Vitrano
text: 'Beautiful place! Very nice staff and amazing food! Relaxing atmosphere and very good service. You got to try the short ribs! It‚Äôs absolutely delicious. For dessert I had the tiramisu‚Äô
column5: it was super delicious!'

author: Maria G
text: 'Food was excellent- Fantastic staff- wonderful ambience! Highly recommend!'

text: 'Great food
column5: friendly staff'

author: nick D
text: 'This place is to die for!!! Service and food is beyond  exceptional. Take it from a business owner for over 45 years!!'
